ovdesc.p: This table is used to setup all possible levels of peeling off to determine the Dealer Desk code which influences how T24 identifies the right accounts to be used for intra branch bookings for ACU and DBU.
PPT.CURRENCYDEALER will be referred only when the field 'IntraBranchPostingEnabled' is set as 'Y' in PPT.COMPANYPROPERTIES.

desc.p: Indicates the company ID for which the record is created. Identify the Owning Bank.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
Ranking should be unique for each company.
Indicates the currency for the posting line which will always be same as the account currency.

Example: If the posting line is for debiting or crediting an USD account then currency1 will be matched with USD. In case posting line is for debiting charges from separate client charge account then it is the currency of client charge account.
Mandatory field.3 alphanumeric characters.The value links to the field 'CurrencyCode' in PPT.CURRENCY and cannot be the same as field 'Currency2'.
Indicates the currency of the other leg of transaction, which could be different in case of FX payment. That can also influence the Dealer Desk to be used.
Example: If the posting line is for principal debit then currency2 will be the currency of principal credit account. And in case of posting line
for debiting charges then this shall be the corresponding Fee currency(which shall be same as P&L account currency).
Mandatory field. 3 alphanumeric characters.The value links to the field 'CurrencyCode' in PPT.CURRENCY and cannot be the same as field 'Currency1'.
Indicates the business line to which the customer belong.
In case of incoming payment this is business line of credit client
In case of outgoing payment this is business line of debit client
In case of book payment, depending on whether posting is for debit client or credit client, respective client’s business line shall be used.

Indicates the book to which a customer's account belongs to. This information is returned by the Account & Customer interface and is used to retrieve a record from this table based on standard peeling logic. This is applicable only for client accounts and not for P & L posting.

Specifies the dealer desk code that influences how T24 identifies the right accounts to be used for intra branch bookings for ACU & DBU. This information is supplied as additional details to T24 so that COB can identify the intra branch suspense accounts for the additional bookings.
Dealer Desk code is the output of this table which will be passed to Posting Interface.
